summary.para: Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the alpha channel.

param.name: alphaDisable
param.para: Type: BOOL

A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the alpha channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the Alpha channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the AlphaLinearTransfer function to the Alpha channel.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the slope of the linear function for the alpha channel.

param.name: alphaSlope
param.para: Type: float
The slope of the linear function for the alpha channel.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the slope of the linear function for the alpha channel.

param.name: animation
param.para: Type: *
An animation that represents how the slope of the linear function for the alpha channel changes over time. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the Y-intercept of the linear function for the alpha channel.

param.name: alphaYIntercept
param.para: Type: float
The Y-intercept of the linear function for the alpha channel.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the Y-intercept of the linear function for the Alpha channel.

param.name: animation
param.para: Type: *
An animation that represents how the the Y-intercept of the linear function for the alpha channel. changes over time. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the Y-intercept of the linear function for the blue channel.

param.name: blueYIntercept
param.para: Type: float
The Y-intercept of the linear function for the blue channel.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the Y-intercept of the linear function for the blue channel.

param.name: animation
param.para: Type: *
An animation that represents how the Y-intercept of the linear function for the blue channel changes over time. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph.

param.name: clampOutput
param.para: Type: BOOL

A boolean value that specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph. If you set this to TRUE the effect will clamp the values. If you set this to FALSE, the effect will not clamp the color values, but other effects and the output surface may clamp the values if they are not of high enough precision.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel.

param.name: greenDisable
param.para: Type: BOOL

A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the GreenLinearTransfer function to the green channel.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: The linear transfer effect is used to map the color intensities of an image using a linear function created from a list of values you provide for each channel.
